availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen Golden (Knox County, Kentucky, captain 49th KY Inf USA )

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Golden and Maryan Golden. Served in the 49th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from June 27, 1863, to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Stinking Creek, p. 91.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 491.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 449.
U.S. Headstone Applications for Military Veterans, 1825-1963, "1925-1941, Gilmore, Edward S.-Good, VG, p. 3011 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
